Docs.summary: Represents a basic step that is displayed in a control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control is made up of a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep> objects that represent single steps of a wizard. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control displays a single <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep> object at a time. You can use a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control and its associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep> objects to collect related data in a linear or nonlinear fashion.
> [!NOTE] > If you embed the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep>, explicitly set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> in a `Page_Load` event handler if the user is authenticated. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control does not automatically advance to the next <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep> in this scenario.
You cannot apply a theme to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep> but you can apply a theme to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep>.
> [!NOTE] > If you programmatically add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep> in the `Page_Load` event handler, you must add the navigation to that step prior to the page loading.
